intro: Stylogyne longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens that are prominently displayed. Stylogyne longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
